author: Tammy F
title: Disgusting and dangerous!
text:
Oh gawd. Where can I start? Rooms are nothing like the photos. They are advertised as soundproofed, air conditioned rooms with a view and a safe. Room was so small that the door did not shut without me moving the bed to enter and exit. View was of a parking lot and the metro. Soundproofing? No! I could hear everything including the man in the room above using the toilet. Our air conditioner kept the room at about 80f with no way of adjusting other than to open the windows and let even more noise into this craptastic room. The one outlet was hanging out of the wall. The bathroom smelled of urine. Safe was broke. Lift could only fit 2 people in an embrace. Stairwell was not lit. Sheets and trash in the hallways. Rude and uncaring desk help.
All of the above would have made this hotel completely unacceptable but wait... They make you leave the key each time you leave. This isn't a hostel. What make this extra bad is that when you return, no one even asks for ID or so much as a name. They simply ask you the room number and give you a key. When we came back in the evening and the front desk guy was sleeping. Joke! The funny thing is that this hotel offers childcare. I can't even imagine!
We are not high maintenance folks. we booked 4 nights, left the next morning, were refused a refund. We ended up a couple blocks away at the Best western. Nothing stellar but it was clean, quiet and safe.
AVOID the HOTEL BALDI!
